intro: Trisetaria forskahlii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and it produces small, clustered flowers. Trisetaria forskahlii is characterized by its unique morphology and is adapted to survive in harsh environmental conditions.
